labels.analysis: The MCP Server focuses on providing access to RubyGems metadata through various tools that allow users to fetch information about RubyGems, search for gems, retrieve version histories, and explore dependencies and ownership details. It primarily serves as an interface to the RubyGems.org API, enabling developers to integrate RubyGems data into their applications seamlessly.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality revolves around accessing and managing RubyGem metadata, which aligns well with the "Development Tools" category. The secondary label "API Integration" is appropriate because the server interacts with the RubyGems.org API. The usage of RubyGems is specific to Ruby development, making a custom label for Ruby-focused tools fitting.

tools.name: get_rubygem_info
tools.description: Get information about a RubyGem from the RubyGems.org API

rubygem_name.description: Name of the RubyGem to fetch information for

tools.name: search_rubygems
tools.description: Search for RubyGems matching a query string. The search matches against gem names and descriptions. Returns up to 10 results by default (customizable with limit parameter), ordered by relevance. Example queries: "authentication", "rails middleware", "aws sdk"

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return (default: 10, max: 30)

tools.name: get_gem_versions
tools.description: Get all available versions of a specific RubyGem

gem_name.description: Name of the RubyGem to fetch versions for

limit.description: Maximum number of versions to return

tools.name: get_gem_reverse_dependencies
tools.description: Get gems that depend on a specific RubyGem

gem_name.description: Name of the RubyGem to fetch reverse dependencies for

tools.name: get_owner_gems
tools.description: Get all RubyGems owned by a specific user or organization

owner_name.description: Username of the RubyGem owner to fetch gems for

tools.name: get_gem_owners
tools.description: Get the owners of a specific RubyGem

gem_name.description: Name of the RubyGem to fetch owners for

server_info_crawled.name: RubyGems Metadata Server
server_info_crawled.author: @6/mcp-server-rubygems
server_info_crawled.overview: Fetch RubyGems metadata effortlessly using our server. Access detailed information about gems, search for specific gems, and retrieve version histories with ease. Enhance your Ruby development experience by integrating RubyGems data directly into your applications.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@6/mcp-server-rubygems/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
